entry.title: Linux cheat sheet
entry.summary: This post is a list of useful command lines for Linux whatever the distribution (Debian, Gentoo, Arch, ...).
entry.content:
This post is a list of useful command lines for Linux whatever the distribution (Debian, Gentoo, Arch, ...).

Network

Check listening

The command line netstat is not used anymore in modern linux distribution.

  • Check listening TCP ports
$ sudo ss -ltn
  • Check listening UDP ports
$ sudo ss -lun

File

  • Search a file by name
$ find / -name "FileName"
  • Create a link
$ ln -s FileName LinkName

file compression

  • Compress with Gunzip
$ tar -czvf file.tar.gz /home/directory

Systemd

  • List unit file
# systemctl list-unit-files

entry.title: Docker Cheat Sheet
entry.summary: This post is a quick reference sheet in one page for Docker
entry.content:
This post is a quick reference sheet in one page for Docker

Container

  • Creates and start a container in one operation
# docker run -td -p 127.0.0.1:$HOSTPORT:$CONTAINERPORT -v $HOSTDIR:$DOCKERDIR

Options: -t allocates a pseudo-TTY session -d runs container in background -p maps the container port to the host port -v maps a directory on the host to a docker container

  • Show running containers
# docker ps

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                    NAMES                     
f91ce070d170        postgres:9.6        "docker-entrypoint.sh"   2 minutes ago       Up 2 minutes        0.0.0.0:5432->5432/tcp   stupefied_easley
  • Stop a running container
# docker stop

Image

  • Show all images
# docker images

Registry & Repository

  • Pull an image from registry to local machine.
# docker pull ImageName
  • Push an image to the registry from local machine.
# docker push

Network

  • List network
# docker network ls

NETWORK ID          NAME                DRIVER              SCOPE

0263e7d36622        host                host                local
1466acd0feda        none                null                local

entry.title: Debian Cheat Sheet
entry.summary: This post is a quick reference sheet in one page for Debian
entry.content:
This post is a quick reference sheet in one page for Debian

Update your Debian

  • Resynchronize the package index files
# apt-get update
  • Install the newest versions of all packages currently installed on the system
# apt-get upgrade

Daemon management (with System V init script)

  • Start a daemon
$ sudo service DaemonName start

Daemon management (with Systemd)

  • Start a daemon
$ sudo systemctl start sshd

Network configuration

  • Show IP address
$ sudo ip address show
  • Set IP address
$ sudo ip addr add 192.168.10.1 dev ens3
